background.text:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. BAIL APPLN. NO. 5318/2018 and CRI. BAIL APPLN. NO. 267/2019 Perused the anticipatory bail application of Vaibhav Vinayak Dhanawade and Raj Ramchandra Borate and say thereon and say filed by original complainant. Perused zerox police papers filed by the accused . Heard the learned Advocate Shri. V.S.Bhargude for the applicant / accused Vaibhav Vinayak Dhanawade, and learned Counsel Shri. Limbekar for the applicant Raj Borate, APP Shri. Salvi for State and learned Counsel Shri. Pratik Sawant for the original complainant. 
2] It is the case of the Prosecution that accused entered into criminal conspiracy and by inducing the complainant obtained amount in lacs from the complainant for giving admission to his son in M.B.B.S Course and thereby he committed an offence punishable under Section 120B, 406, 420 r.w 34 of Indian Penal Code vide CR No. 91/2018, with Dattatwadi Police Station.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 120b, 406, 420 r.w 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 3] The Ld.Counsel Shri. Bhargude for the applicant Vaibhav submitted that co­accused Prakash Gaidhane is released on bail by this Court by order dt. 15.06.2018 in CNR­MHPU01­017340­2018 CNR­MHPU01­000925­2019 Criminal Bail Apln No. 1578/2018 u/S 438 of Cr.P.C. Name of the applicant does not figure in FIR. Co­accused Vyankatesh Mishra during remand has disclosed the name of the applicant. There is delay in complaint. Custody is not required. He has regularly attended Police Station. Lastly, he prayed for confirmation of ad­interim protection.

argumentSentences.text: 3] The Ld.Counsel Shri.
Bhargude for the applicant Vaibhav submitted that co­accused Prakash Gaidhane is released on bail by this Court by order dt.
15.06.2018 in CNR­MHPU01­017340­2018 CNR­MHPU01­000925­2019 Criminal Bail Apln No. 1578/2018 u/S 438 of Cr.P.C.
Name of the applicant does not figure in FIR.
Co­accused Vyankatesh Mishra during remand has disclosed the name of the applicant.
There is delay in complaint.
Custody is not required.
He has regularly attended Police Station.
Lastly, he prayed for confirmation of ad­interim protection.

arguments.text: 4] The learned Counsel Shri. Limbekar for the applicant Raj Borate has submitted that complainant has not submitted real facts. He has not come to the Court with clean hands. Prakash Gaidhane being a friend of complainant, introduced with other accused. Complainant is blackmailing the accused persons. As per complainant he has paid or deposited only Rs. 25 lakhs but more amount is received by him. Bail application of Vaikunth Mishra is granted by Hon'ble High Court on deposit of Rs. 5.5 lakhs. He visited Investigating Officer for 3 to 4 times and helped the Investigating Officer in investigation. Complainant is threatening the accused persons. Lastly, he has also prayed for anticipatory bail.

argumentSentences.text: 4] The learned Counsel Shri.
Limbekar for the applicant Raj Borate has submitted that complainant has not submitted real facts.
He has not come to the Court with clean hands.
Prakash Gaidhane being a friend of complainant, introduced with other accused.
Complainant is blackmailing the accused persons.
As per complainant he has paid or deposited only Rs. 25 lakhs but more amount is received by him.
Bail application of Vaikunth Mishra is granted by Hon'ble High Court on deposit of Rs. 5.5 lakhs.
He visited Investigating Officer for 3 to 4 times and helped the Investigating Officer in investigation.
Complainant is threatening the accused persons.
Lastly, he has also prayed for anticipatory bail.

arguments.text: 5] The learned APP Shri. Salvi submitted that on the complaint of complainant matter was referred under Sec. 156(3) of Cr.P.C. There is sufficient material against  accused, which was collected from whatsapp message. Applicants have not attended the police station and not supplied the information. Custody of the accused persons is required for getting true information regarding the complaint of complainant.

argumentSentences.text: 5] The learned APP Shri.
Salvi submitted that on the complaint of complainant matter was referred under Sec. 156(3) of Cr.P.C.
There is sufficient material against  accused, which was collected from whatsapp message.
Applicants have not attended the police station and not supplied the information.
Custody of the accused persons is required for getting true information regarding the complaint of complainant.

arguments.text: 6] The learned Counsel Shri. Sawant for the original complainant submitted that the time was spent in filing complaint and prior to that regarding case under Sec. 138 of N.I. Act. There is active role of Barate. Gravity of the offence needs to be considered. Complainant is not a victim but his son who lost one year is a victim. It is cold blooded offence. Accused have admitted the crime. No parity is applicable.

argumentSentences.text: 6] The learned Counsel Shri.
Sawant for the original complainant submitted that the time was spent in filing complaint and prior to that regarding case under Sec. 138 of N.I. Act.
There is active role of Barate.
Gravity of the offence needs to be considered.
Complainant is not a victim but his son who lost one year is a victim.
It is cold blooded offence.
Accused have admitted the crime.
No parity is applicable.

arguments.text: 7] From the face of record, it can be gathered that complainant has paid / deposited Rs. 25 lakhs i.e., (9,00,000/­+14,000,00/­+ 2,00,000/­ = 25 lakhs). Against the same complainant has received 16,90,000/­ + 3,40,000/­ + 5,50,000/­ (which is deposited by accused Mishra before Hon'ble High Court) in Criminal Bail Appln No. 71/2019 dt. 16.01.2019. Besides, from the face of record it can be gathered that Mishra has received the amount in presence of the present applicant and they both were in the company of complainant time to time to visit  Shri. Mishra. There are no allegations of the complainant that the applicants have personally received any amount from complainant towards the admission of his son for M.B.B.S Course.

argumentSentences.text: 7] From the face of record, it can be gathered that complainant has paid / deposited Rs. 25 lakhs i.e., (9,00,000/­+14,000,00/­+ 2,00,000/­ = 25 lakhs).
Against the same complainant has received 16,90,000/­ + 3,40,000/­ + 5,50,000/­ (which is deposited by accused Mishra before Hon'ble High Court) in Criminal Bail Appln No. 71/2019 dt.

Besides, from the face of record it can be gathered that Mishra has received the amount in presence of the present applicant and they both were in the company of complainant time to time to visit  Shri.
Mishra.
There are no allegations of the complainant that the applicants have personally received any amount from complainant towards the admission of his son for M.B.B.S Course.

arguments.text: 8] Having considered the nature of offence and circumstances that most of the amount is received by the complainant against its deposit or payment. Therefore, in my considered view nothing is to be recovered or discovered from the applicants and custodial interrogation is not required from the applicants. Hence, I proceed to pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: 8] Having considered the nature of offence and circumstances that most of the amount is received by the complainant against its deposit or payment.
Therefore, in my considered view nothing is to be recovered or discovered from the applicants and custodial interrogation is not required from the applicants.
Hence, I proceed to pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER 1] Both Criminal Bail Applications No. 5318/2018 and Criminal Bail Application No. 267/2019 are allowed. 2] Ad­interim anticipatory bail granted to accused Vaibhav Vinayak Dhanawade on dt. 21.12.2018 below Exhibit. 3 is hereby confirmed on same terms and conditions. 3] In the event of arrest of Raj Ramchandra Borate, he be released on furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.20,000/­ with solvent surety of the like amount on following conditions :­ CNR­MHPU01­017340­2018 CNR­MHPU01­000925­2019 1] The accused shall make himself available for interrogation by a police officer as and when required; 2] The accused shall not, directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any Police Officer. 3] The accused shall not leave State of Maharashtra without the previous permission of the Court. 4] The accused shall not tamper the prosecution evidence. 3] Copy of this order be attached with Criminal Bail Application No. 267/2019.

processedText:
CNR­MHPU01­017340­2018 CNR­MHPU01­000925­2019 COMMON 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. BAIL APPLN. NO. 5318/2018 and CRI. BAIL APPLN. NO. 267/2019 Perused the anticipatory bail application of Vaibhav Vinayak Dhanawade and Raj Ramchandra Borate and say thereon and say filed by original complainant. Perused zerox police papers filed by the accused . Heard the learned Advocate Shri. V.S.Bhargude for the applicant / accused Vaibhav Vinayak Dhanawade, and learned Counsel Shri. Limbekar for the applicant Raj Borate, APP Shri. Salvi for State and learned Counsel Shri. Pratik Sawant for the original complainant. 
2] It is the case of the Prosecution that accused entered into criminal conspiracy and by inducing the complainant obtained amount in lacs from the complainant for giving admission to his son in M.B.B.S Course and thereby he committed an offence punishable under Section 120B, 406, 420 r.w 34 of Indian Penal Code vide CR No. 91/2018, with Dattatwadi Police Station. 
---background-ends---
3] The Ld.Counsel Shri. Bhargude for the applicant Vaibhav submitted that co­accused Prakash Gaidhane is released on bail by this Court by order dt. 15.06.2018 in CNR­MHPU01­017340­2018 CNR­MHPU01­000925­2019 Criminal Bail Apln No. 1578/2018 u/S 438 of Cr.P.C. Name of the applicant does not figure in FIR. Co­accused Vyankatesh Mishra during remand has disclosed the name of the applicant. There is delay in complaint. Custody is not required. He has regularly attended Police Station. Lastly, he prayed for confirmation of ad­interim protection. 
---argument-ends---
4] The learned Counsel Shri. Limbekar for the applicant Raj Borate has submitted that complainant has not submitted real facts. He has not come to the Court with clean hands. Prakash Gaidhane being a friend of complainant, introduced with other accused. Complainant is blackmailing the accused persons. As per complainant he has paid or deposited only Rs. 25 lakhs but more amount is received by him. Bail application of Vaikunth Mishra is granted by Hon'ble High Court on deposit of Rs. 5.5 lakhs. He visited Investigating Officer for 3 to 4 times and helped the Investigating Officer in investigation. Complainant is threatening the accused persons. Lastly, he has also prayed for anticipatory bail. 
---argument-ends---
5] The learned APP Shri. Salvi submitted that on the complaint of complainant matter was referred under Sec. 156(3) of Cr.P.C. There is sufficient material against  accused, which was collected from whatsapp message. Applicants have not attended the police station and not supplied the information. Custody of the accused persons is required for getting true information regarding the complaint of complainant. 
---argument-ends---
6] The learned Counsel Shri. Sawant for the original complainant submitted that the time was spent in filing complaint and prior to that regarding case under Sec. 138 of N.I. Act. There is active role of Barate. Gravity of the offence needs to be considered. Complainant is not a victim but his son who lost one year is a victim. It is cold blooded offence. Accused have admitted the crime. No parity is applicable. 
---argument-ends---
7] From the face of record, it can be gathered that complainant has paid / deposited Rs. 25 lakhs i.e., (9,00,000/­+14,000,00/­+ 2,00,000/­ = 25 lakhs). Against the same complainant has received 16,90,000/­ + 3,40,000/­ + 5,50,000/­ (which is deposited by accused Mishra before Hon'ble High Court) in Criminal Bail Appln No. 71/2019 dt. 16.01.2019. Besides, from the face of record it can be gathered that Mishra has received the amount in presence of the present applicant and they both were in the company of complainant time to time to visit  Shri. Mishra. There are no allegations of the complainant that the applicants have personally received any amount from complainant towards the admission of his son for M.B.B.S Course. 
---argument-ends---
8] Having considered the nature of offence and circumstances that most of the amount is received by the complainant against its deposit or payment. Therefore, in my considered view nothing is to be recovered or discovered from the applicants and custodial interrogation is not required from the applicants. Hence, I proceed to pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] Both Criminal Bail Applications No. 5318/2018 and Criminal Bail Application No. 267/2019 are allowed. 2] Ad­interim anticipatory bail granted to accused Vaibhav Vinayak Dhanawade on dt. 21.12.2018 below Exhibit. 3 is hereby confirmed on same terms and conditions. 3] In the event of arrest of Raj Ramchandra Borate, he be released on furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.20,000/­ with solvent surety of the like amount on following conditions :­ CNR­MHPU01­017340­2018 CNR­MHPU01­000925­2019 1] The accused shall make himself available for interrogation by a police officer as and when required; 2] The accused shall not, directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the Court or to any Police Officer. 3] The accused shall not leave State of Maharashtra without the previous permission of the Court. 4] The accused shall not tamper the prosecution evidence. 3] Copy of this order be attached with Criminal Bail Application No. 267/2019. 
---order-ends---
